Honestly, it isn't even his winrate that bothers me; I just find him rather annoying to play with or against due to the nature of his kit.

I'm well aware that he isn't overpowered but I find several aspect of his kit rather irritating and he tends to attract toxic players.
--------------------------
If they do decide to nerf him, some decent ideas may be:

* Windwall has a slight delay before taking effect (so he can't block projectiles by casting it in the complete opposite direction)
* Ultimate no longer positions Yasuo outside of tower range whenever even remotely possible
They complain about it since release. I somehow doubt it's getting nerfed _now_.

Truth be told I'm against 10 bans.

I'd rather have Riot give bans to the first 3 picks instead.

Reason: I actually like playing against and - sometimes - as Yasuo.

If the bans went to the first 3, then the last 2 picks on each team would be sitting there dominated by the first picks again. Moving the bans to the last people allowed them some power in the pick process instead of being at the mercy of the first few players.

At the moment, players lower in the pick order get to ban champions and have the best chance of counterpicking their opponents.

First picks are just getting counterpicked.
Counterpicking doesn't matter for the grand majority of the playerbase. For about 90-95% of the players of this game, playing the champion you are most comfortable with is best.

While playing a champion you know is best, there is nothing wrong with knowing multiple champions and picking the best one of the situation.
-----------------------
For example, suppose I were a top laner with the following champion pool (whom I am comfortable and experienced with):
{{champion:57}} {{champion:78}} {{champion:27}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:111}} 

Certain champions are far better in certain matchups than others.

Am I against Riven?  Poppy is great at denying her the opportunity to snowball and at shutting her down during teamfights.

Am I against Nasus?  Darius is fantastic at zoning and killing Nasus throughout the game.

Am I dealing with a squishy ranged opponent?  Irelia will survive, farm and tear them to pieces.
-------------------------
I don't recommend picking a champion you don't know just because it happens to counter your opponent.  If you don't know how to use your champion or how the matchup plays out, you won't be very useful.

However, if a champion you are experienced with happens to counter your opponent, you can get a massive advantage before the game even starts.

>If the bans went to the first 3, then the last 2 picks on each team would be sitting there dominated by the first picks again. 

Excuse me, but do you actually remember why first picks were "dominating"?
Why, of course you don't.

It would've been fair for last picks to have bans in Seasons 1 through 5, because the lower was your pick, the lower was your chance to get the role you wanted, due to Pick Order being the rule.

Not in Season 6 and 7 where everybody gets to pick the role they want without fail.

There is zero advantage for being a first pick in Solo Queue, because the possibility of a champion trade is nearly non-existent, while it makes no difference for premades.

>Moving the bans to the last people allowed them some power in the pick process instead of being at the mercy of the first few players.

Last picks currently get:

- roles they want
- a very high chance to counterpick the enemy
- an ability to shield their picks with bans.

Meanwhile first picks:

- open themselves to getting outright counterpicked
- don't get any sort of protection for their picks
- are at the mercy of last picks to ban champions they will have problems with - which doesn't happen most of the time, because Yasuo must be banned, even if he's a shit champ that's easily counterable with most champions.

Last picks currently get no threat of their champ being banned by salty people who dont get their preferred role as well. Like I said above, counterpicks dont matter to about 90-95% of players because you are more likely to win on your most comfortable champion anyway. They aren't at the mercy of the last picks, because last picks will ban the champions that the whole team will have a problem with, instead of just banning someone cause they want to firstpick another strong champ and force a weaker laner, but maybe not a weaker teamfighter.

No, ultimately people always ban champions they find frustrating, not champions that are strong and actually give the enemy team a chance to win.

For example last season I was telling people to not ban Yasuo.
Not because I wanted to play him, but because if the enemy team picked him, they'd instantly play a 4v5 match, either because Yasuo would be obliterated or because his jungler would have to lane with him the whole time.
But the same champion would get shit on by Zed in most cases.

Counterpicks do matter.
At least for people like me.
I'm not affraid to pick a different champion if I had to put myself in a losing position otherwise.

For example Heimer vs Syndra. Heimer isn't going to win, unless Syndra player is a potato.
Would you gamble picking Heimer knowing they have Syndra or rather pick Diana who dumpsters Syndra at level 6+ or Lux who can play safe and scale better?
